content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Coal Mining Operation at (-14, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0) mining coal
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) collecting coal output

###Iron Mining Operation at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0) mining iron ore
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) collecting iron ore output

###Copper Processing Line at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Input wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) 
- Middle wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
- Output wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates
- Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving ore between input and middle chest
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving processed plates to output chest
- Burner inserter at (22.5, 22.5) attempting to feed furnace

###Unused Furnace Setup
Two stone furnaces at (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0) without active production

ERROR TIPS

###Furnace Fuel Management Issues
- Check furnace fuel capacity before attempting to insert more coal. The furnace at (24.0, 20.0) has reached its fuel limit of 50 items

###Inserter Placement and Configuration Issues
- Ensure inserters have valid pickup and drop locations with appropriate entities at both ends
- The burner inserter at (22.5, 22.5) has no valid destination entity to drop items into
- Configure inserter directions properly to establish working material flow between entities

###Production Line Design
- When setting up production lines, ensure complete end-to-end connectivity between all components
- Verify that all inserters in the production chain have valid source and destination entities
